solvents.name: methanol
solvents.amount: 4 ml total (2 ml for Co(SO4)∙7H2O solution and 2 ml for 4,4′-bipyridine solution)

synthesis_conditions.equipment: sample vial with a screw cap

synthesis_conditions.description: Heating a single crystal of 1 to 368 K for 1 hour resulted in the crystal changing color from pink to purple, without the loss of crystallinity or diffracting power, to afford the desolvated material 1′.

After the crystal of 1′ was cooled back to 298 K and exposed to the laboratory atmosphere, water was taken up to give a rehydrated phase, 1″; the water displaces the substituted ligands at the chain sites in 1′ to return the structure to that of 1.
